Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Rectangle

  • public class Rectangle
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of the class Rectangle represents rectangles that are mind for work on a virtual canvas during the first introduction to objects. They are defined by their position, size and color. The position of instance is defined as the position of its upper left corner.
    Version:
    1.01.4240 — 2012-10-13
    Author:
    Rudolf PECINOVSKÝ

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static NamedColor DEFAULT_COLOR
      The default named color of created instances for the case, when the caller doesn't set any - for rectangles it si NamedColor.RED.
      protected int height
      The instance height.
      static int MAX_STEP
      Maximal allowed size of the step.
      protected int width
      The instance width.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rectangle()
      Creates a new instance with default position, size and color.

      Creates a new instance with given position and size and with default color.
      Rectangle(int x, int y, int width, int height, NamedColor color)
      Creates a new instance with given position, size and color.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_COLOR

        public static final NamedColor DEFAULT_COLOR
        The default named color of created instances for the case, when the caller doesn't set any - for rectangles it si NamedColor.RED.

      • height

        protected int height
        The instance height.

        public static final int MAX_STEP
        Maximal allowed size of the step.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • width

        protected int width
        The instance width.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle()
        Creates a new instance with default position, size and color. The instance will be placed in the upper left corner of the canvas, it will have a default color, height equals the step and width equals twice the step (default 50×100).

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        Creates a new instance with given position and size and with default color. The position of instance is defined as the position of its upper left corner.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal coordinate, left canvas border has x=0, coordinate increases to the right
        y - The vertical coordinate, upper canvas border has y=0, coordinate increases to the down
        width - The width of the instance - must be > 0
        height - The height of the instance - must be > 0

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 NamedColor color)
        Creates a new instance with given position, size and color. The position of instance is defined as the position of its upper left corner.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal coordinate, left canvas border has x=0, coordinate increases to the right
        y - The vertical coordinate, upper canvas border has y=0, coordinate increases to the down
        width - The width of the instance - must be > 0
        height - The height of the instance - must be > 0
        color - The color of the instance

        Returns the default distance (step) of movement used in parameterless movement commands.
        Returns:
        The default distance of movement in points

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the current width of the instance.
        Returns:
        The current width of the instance

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the current x coordinate of the instance, which means the horizontal position of the its upper left corner.  
        Returns:
        The horizontal coordinate, left canvas border has x=0, coordinate increases to the right

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the current y coordinate of the instance, which means the vertical position of the its upper left corner.  
        Returns:
        The vertical coordinate, upper canvas border has y=0, coordinate increases down

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown()
        Move the instance by the default amount of points down. This number can be obtained by call the static method getStep() and set by call the static method setStep(int).

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown(int distance)
        Move the instance by the specified amount of points down or (by negative argument) up.
        Parameters:
        distance - Distance for move

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Move the instance by the default amount of points to the left. This number can be obtained by call the static method getStep() and set by call the static method setStep(int).

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Move the instance by the default amount of points to the right. This number can be obtained by call the static method getStep() and set by call the static method setStep(int).

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight(int distance)
        Move the instance by the specified amount of points to the right or (by negative argument) left.
        Parameters:
        distance - Distance for move

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp()
        Move the instance by the default amount of points up. This number can be obtained by call the static method getStep() and set by call the static method setStep(int).

      • paint

        public void paint()
        Paints the instance on the canvas.

      • rubOut

        public void rubOut()
        Rubs out the instance from the canvas (repaints it by the background color).

      • setColor

        public void setColor(NamedColor color)
        Sets a new color of the instance.
        Parameters:
        color - The new color of the instance

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int x,
                        int y)
        Sets a position of the instance (new values of its coordinates) and moves the instance to this position. The position of instance is defined as the position of its upper left corner.
        Parameters:
        x - The newly set horizontal coordinate, Left canvas border has x=0, coordinate increases to the right
        y - The newly set vertical coordinate, upper canvas border has y=0, coordinate increases to the down

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int size)
        Sets a new "square" size of the instance, which means it set the specified size to its width as well as to its height. The set dimensions must be non-negative, the zero value is substituted by one.
        Parameters:
        size - The new dimensions of the instance; dimension >= 0

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
        Sets a new dimensions of the instance. The set dimensions must be non-negative, the zero value is substituted by one.
        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the instance; width >= 0
        height - The new height of the instance; height >= 0

      • setStep

        public static void setStep(int distance)
        Sets the default distance (step) of movement used in parameterless movement commands.
        Parameters:
        distance - The default distance of movement;
        0 <= distance <= MAX_STEP must be true

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the object (object's signature). It is used mainly by the debugging.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Name of the instance followed by its coordinates, dimensions and color
